answerText: Carbonic anhydrases [or carbonate dehydratases] [10] Carbonic anhydrase is the first known enzyme to contain an ion of this 4th row metal, found only in the +2 state in living organisms and is always bound to four or more ligands.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC San Diego and Washington University and Chicago B | 12 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: It is one of the fastest enzymes known, capable of increasing the reaction rate by ten million times,  [10] Identify this group of enzyme which catalyzes the hydration of CO2 into H2CO3, the most active of which is the II form.
